snippet: After thousands embarked on a 300-mile march toward Germany on Friday, the government retreated from enforcing European immigration restrictions.
abstract: Austrian government announces that thousands of migrants kept behind Hungarian border will be given entrance to Austria and Germany; move, following emergency session of top Hungarian officials, comes in response to several days of chaotic protest by migrants kept in squalid conditions at Hungary-Austria border.

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE, RICK LYMAN and ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS
byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Nickelsdorf and Vienna, and Rick Lyman and Anemona Hartocollis from Budapest. Reporting was contributed by Palko Karasz from Budapest; Dan Bilefsky and Steven Erlanger from London; Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva; James Kanter from Brussels; Hana de Goeij from Prague; Karam Shoumali from Istanbul; and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: After thousands embarked on a 300-mile march toward Germany on Friday, the government retreated from enforcing European immigration restrictions.

headline.main: Migrants Cross Austria Border From Hungary
headline.print_headline: Migrants Cross Austria Border From Hungary

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
